div.l: She gropeþ al wey forther with hire honde
And fond þe bedde and þoughte nouȝt but good
Bi cause that þe cradel bi it stood
And nyst where she was for it was derk
But faire and wel sche crepe in to þe clerk
And lith ful stille ⁊and wolde haue caught a slepe
Wit Inne a while þis Iohn þe clerk vp lepe
And on þis gode wif he leyth on sore
So mery a Fytte ne hadde she not ful yore
He priketh harde ⁊and depe as he ware madde
This Ioly lyf han þese two clerkes ladde
Til þat þe þridde cok by gan to synge
¶ Aleyn wax wery in þe dawenynge
For he hadde swonken alle þe longe nyght
And seid farewel malyn swete wight
The day is come I may no lengere bide
But eủeremo where so I go or ryde
I am þin owne clerk so haue I sele
Now dere lēmman qduod she go fare wele
But or þow go oo þing I wol þe telle
Whan þat þow wendest homward bi the melle
Right at the entre of the dore bi hynde
Þu shalt a kake of half a busshel fynde
Þat was I maked of þin owne mele
Which þat I hilpe my sire for to stele
And gode lēmman god þe saue and kepe
And with þat word almost he gan to wepe
Aleyn vp rist ⁊and þoughte or þat it dawe
I wil go crepen in by my felowe
And fond þe cradel with his honde anoon
Bi god thought he al wrang I haue mys gon
Myn hed is toty of my swynk to nyght
That maketh me þat I go nouȝt a right
I woot wel by þe cradel I haue mysgo
Here lyth þe meller ⁊and his wif also
And forth he goth on twenti deuel way ⁊And forth
Vnto þe bedde þer as þe Mellere lay
He wende haue cropen bi his felow Iohn
And bi þe meller in he crepe anoon
And caughte him by þe nekke ⁊and softe he spak
He seide þow Iohn þow swyneshed a wak
